1.text: ‘When I give healing to Israel, Then revealed is the iniquity of Ephraim, And the wickedness of Samaria, For they have wrought falsehood, And a thief doth come in, Stript off hath a troop in the street,

2.text: And they do not say to their heart, That all their evil I have remembered, Now compassed them have their doings, Over-against My face they have been.

3.text: With their wickedness they make glad a king, And with their lies—princes.

4.text: All of them are adulterers, Like a burning oven of a baker, He ceaseth from stirring up after kneading the dough, till its leavening.

5.text: A day of our king! Princes have polluted themselves with the poison of wine, He hath drawn out his hand with scorners.

6.text: For they have drawn near, As an oven is their heart, In their lying in wait all the night sleep doth their baker, Morning! he is burning as a flaming fire.

7.text: All of them are warm as an oven, And they have devoured their judges, All their kings have fallen, There is none calling unto Me among them.

8.text: Ephraim! among peoples he mixeth himself, Ephraim hath been a cake unturned.

9.text: Devoured have strangers his power, And he hath not known, Also old age hath sprinkled itself on him, And he hath not known.

10.text: And humbled hath been the excellency of Israel to his face, And they have not turned back unto Jehovah their God, Nor have they sought Him for all this.

11.text: And Ephraim is as a simple dove without heart, Egypt they called on—to Asshur they have gone.

12.text: When they go I spread over them My net, As the fowl of the heavens I bring them down, I chastise them as their company hath heard.

13.text: Woe to them, for they wandered from Me, Destruction to them, for they transgressed against Me, And I—I ransom them, and they have spoken lies against Me,

14.text: And have not cried unto Me with their heart, but howl on their beds, For corn and new wine they assemble themselves, They turn aside against Me.

15.text: And I instructed—I strengthened their arms, And concerning Me they think evil!

16.text: They turn back—not to the Most High, They have been as a deceitful bow, Fall by sword do their princes, From the insolence of their tongue, This is their derision in the land of Egypt!
